title: How to Make Gummy Worm Cupcakes

steps.headline: Prepare and bake the cake, following the directions.
steps.description: Use the oven temperature and bake time according to the recipe as well.

steps.headline: Place the cupcakes on a cooling rack to cool completely.
Prepare the gummy worms.
steps.description: You can leave them as whole or cut them in half, depending on your taste.

steps.headline: Serve the cupcakes in two fun ways:
steps.description:
With frosting: Use a knife to lightly spread the chocolate frosting on each cupcake. Sprinkle the cookie crumbs on top of the frosting for a "dirt" appearance. Lay two or three gummy worms or pieces on the top of the cookie crumbs. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/dd\/Make-Gummy-Worm-Cupcakes-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-Gummy-Worm-Cupcakes-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/dd\/Make-Gummy-Worm-Cupcakes-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-Gummy-Worm-Cupcakes-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Without frosting: Gently push the ends of the gummy worms into the cupcake top, so that they appear to be "digging". Use fork prongs to gently "puff up" the cupcake top around the worms to create a small "dirt mess". {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/16\/Make-Gummy-Worm-Cupcakes-Step-4Bullet2.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-Gummy-Worm-Cupcakes-Step-4Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/16\/Make-Gummy-Worm-Cupcakes-Step-4Bullet2.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-Gummy-Worm-Cupcakes-Step-4Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

text:
Prepare and bake the cake, following the directions. Use the oven temperature and bake time according to the recipe as well. Place the cupcakes on a cooling rack to cool completely. Prepare the gummy worms. You can leave them as whole or cut them in half, depending on your taste. Serve the cupcakes in two fun ways: With frosting: Use a knife to lightly spread the chocolate frosting on each cupcake. Sprinkle the cookie crumbs on top of the frosting for a "dirt" appearance. Lay two or three gummy worms or pieces on the top of the cookie crumbs. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/dd\/Make-Gummy-Worm-Cupcakes-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-Gummy-Worm-Cupcakes-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/dd\/Make-Gummy-Worm-Cupcakes-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-Gummy-Worm-Cupcakes-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Without frosting: Gently push the ends of the gummy worms into the cupcake top, so that they appear to be "digging". Use fork prongs to gently "puff up" the cupcake top around the worms to create a small "dirt mess". {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/16\/Make-Gummy-Worm-Cupcakes-Step-4Bullet2.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-Gummy-Worm-Cupcakes-Step-4Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/16\/Make-Gummy-Worm-Cupcakes-Step-4Bullet2.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-Gummy-Worm-Cupcakes-Step-4Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}
